title: Oil rises over 1% on hopes for deeper OPEC cuts, Chinese factory growth
text: Oil prices rose more than 1% on Monday as signs of rising manufacturing activity in China pointed to increasing fuel demand, and hints that OPEC may deepen output cuts at its meeting this week indicated supply may tighten next year.

title: Many firms have no contingency plans should US-China trade war worsen, DHL survey says
text: "We're now dealing with such a new frontier that most supply chain professionals have not encountered this before and its so new that I think a lot of people are struggling to even understand what they can do to deal with it," DHL says.

title: U.S.-China 'phase one' trade deal expected 'year-end at the earliest': report
text: A "phase one" trade deal is unlikely to be agreed upon before late December, Axios reported Sunday.

title: Many firms have no contingency plans should U.S.-China trade war worsen: DHL survey
text: As the U.S.-China trade war drags into its 16th month and continues to disrupt supply chains, more than one-quarter of multinational firms have not made contingency plans, showed a survey from a subsidiary of courier giant DHL.

title: Global stocks tick up on upbeat China factory reports, trade talk hopes
text: Global shares rose on Monday and oil rebounded after upbeat China manufacturing surveys and as investors clung to hopes Beijing and Washington could reach a compromise in trade talks.

title: Oil jumps on Chinese factory growth, hopes for deeper OPEC cuts
text: Oil prices rose more than 1% on Monday as signs of rising manufacturing activity in China pointed to increasing fuel demand and hints that OPEC may deepen output cuts at its meeting this week indicated supply may tighten next year.

title: U.S.-China trade deal 'stalled because of Hong Kong legislation': Axios
text: A trade deal between United States and China was now "stalled because of Hong Kong legislation", news website Axios reported on Sunday, citing a source close to U.S. President Donald Trump's negotiating team.

title: China 'insists' on tariff rollbacks as part of 'phase one' trade deal: report
text: China is insisting that U.S. tariffs be rolled back as part of any "phase one" trade deal, China's state-run Global Times said Sunday.

title: This is where the Dow would be this year without Apple and Microsoft
text: Apple and Microsoft have had massive rallies this year. Here's how much they've contributed to the Dow's record run.

title: China wants U.S. tariffs rolled back in phase one trade deal: Global Times
text: Beijing's top priority in any phase one trade deal with the United States is the removal of existing tariffs on Chinese goods, China's Global Times newspaper reported on Sunday, amid uncertainty on whether the two sides can end a 17-month trade war that has depressed global growth.

title: Best Year Since 2013 – What’s Next?
text: With just one month left in 2019, the S&P 500 is on track to record one of the best yearly gains in this bull market. Is this significant for the stock market’s performance in 2020 or should investors and traders be watching something else?

title: How The Yield Curve Predicted Every Recession For The Past 50 Years
text: The yield curve was once just a wonky graph for academics and policymakers.

title: Thanksgiving Edition II: Speculating And Trading, Rules And Recommendations
text: Cash management isn't about cash in itself; it's a way of enforcing trading discipline that removes emotion in profit and loss taking. Emotion kills trading success.
